column13: I heard of the restaurant when I first came to town 10 years ago, but visited for the first time recently. The restaurant is beautiful inside, and has at least two seating areas. It was busy, but the noise level was fine. Service was erratic, with a waiter that may have been overworked. Water and drink orders took a long time to come out, but the hostess did a great job coming by to check on our table. The food was mediocre at best. Sides seem dated (vegetable medley and mashed potatoes), and the medium rare ostrich came very overcooked. The flavor of the curry was fine, but came with an odd assortment of vegetables and bananas. For the price point, there are much better restaurants in Sandy Springs, let alone all of Atlanta. I

We loved the setting - very nice historical building. Restaurant is in the basement with fire places and the original stone floor. We ate early so it was not busy and the room was quiet. Would be a bit noisier if full. The bar is in a separate area so the noise did not bleed into the restaurant. Food was wonderful - my husband really enjoyed the Shrimp and Scallop Scampi and I loved the Boursin Chicken. Service ranked as one of the best experiences I have had anywhere. Stephen was wonderful!

Located in the heart of the Old 4th Ward just east of Midtown/Downtown on North Avenue, 4th & Swift is consistently one of Atlanta's top five restaurants. Chef owned and operated, inspired by local and southern ingredients, 4th & Swift is one of the places that makes Atlanta's restaurant scene special.
Got engaged at 700 Drayton and the whole staff was incredible. They made it a very memorable evening. We will definitely be going back there the next time we are in Savannah!

I would not recommend it right now. I did not dis-like it, it just didn't "wow" me enough to recommend it. I liked the menu, but I think I would like to try a few more things before passing judgment. The appetizers were great (Blue Cheese fondue chips and lobster macaroni). The main courses needed a little work. The biscuit and gravy (really a seafood gravy) sounded great but didn't quite blend well. The steak and fries was over cooked but tased well. We were too close to the people around us and they the couple next to us were just miserable people and it put a damper on the evening. Like I said, I loved the menu and want to give it another try before making recommendations.

The food was absolutely out of this world. Everything was perfectly seasoned and the food was playful and fun. The only issue I had was that I would've liked the food coursed out instead of a barrage all at once. Next time I'll just order one thing at a time. Overall it was great though.
I must say that I enjoyed myself. The service, music, & scene was inviting.

column1: Adam's American Mediterranean Restaurant and Piano Bar
column13: On the Continental scene, salads are served after the main course. In the U.S. they will precede. Well, Adam has several salads, and to repeat what a son-in-law said after he devoured Adam's Wedge, "That was the BEST salad I ever had!" I totally agree and urge you to partake of pure joy as I did last visit. The imagination on the menu and with the specialities abound here. Enjoy them.

column4: 10010 B Ford Ave Richmond Hill, GA  31324
column13: Ailsa's is sort of tucked away and off of the main road, but it is a great local place for residents of Richmond Hill who don't want to drive all the way into Savannah for a great dinner. The food was excellent and we will definitely be back to try the other items we didn't choose this time. The table we were seated at was a bit too small and the staff seem like they could use a little more practice, but were very accomodating and helpful. There is karaoke on Friday nights, which is odd since there were approximately 5 patrons in the restaurant by the time they started it, but the piano player that played before that during dinner set a great mood. But overall, a great experience we plan on having again!
This was my first time dining at Aja. It was a good experience. The staff was friendly and helpful.

We moved to savannah two months ago and have heard of Aligator Soul from several individuals as well as on Paula Deen's show. My husband and I booked a reservation for our anniversary and it was the perfect place. The food was amazing and very seasonal. Our experience overall was exceptional, I would recommend this restaurant anyway and we will definitely return.
All around highly recommended. Chicken Tinga Tostadas, Wagu Enchiladas, Summer Breeze drink and the Chicken Fajitas like no other! Excellent meal.
food mediorcre. staff needs to learn to smile more and patience. place use to be alot better. just my opinion, they might have just had an off night.

If you like a very French atmosphere, great service and great food, you'll love this place. I rarely go anywhere twice because there are so many great restaurants in Atlanta. That said, this is where I bring all my out of town friends and family and I keep bringing them and they all love it. Everything is delicious. Duck Con fit, Escargot, Chicken, Trout, Osso Buco, Profiteroles. Enjoyed by all.

Antebellum was a great dining experience. I was happy to find this restaurant 30+ miles north of the city. For appetizers we had the Fried Green Tomatoes and Andouille Sausage and they were scrumptious. For entrees we had the Duck Special and the Rib-eye Steak and the portions were generous and they were both made perfectly to order. Lastly for dessert we had the Red Velvet Cake and the Chocolate Flour-less cake and they were really good. Our server Karis was so friendly and sweet. We were seated right next to the gentleman playing the guitar and it created such a relaxing mood. We really love our experience and we will definitely back.

column4: 519 East Paces Ferry Road Atlanta, GA  30305
column13: A very good menu with excellent execution. We especially liked the ability to order small plates so that we could mix and match the flavors of this fine restaurant. We could have used a little less "sell up" by our waiter, however. We ended up with two extra dishes that we didn't need and a $44 bottle of olive oil. Nevertheless, we will come back and will be more knowledgeable next time.

column1: Aqua Star at The Westin Savannah Golf Resort & Spa
column13: Took my son to Aqua Star for his birthday. We had a wonderful time. Food was outstanding! Enjoyed the live music. Definitely a hit!

column4: 490 E. Paces Ferry Rd. Atlanta, GA  30305
column13: Simple yet elegant decor, , Aria has just the right light and brightnes, unlike the usual dark rooms you find in fine dining restaurants.Friendly and professional staff.Food was wonderful. Will come back.

We drove by Aspens for years and never went. Finally decided to give it a try and we have really enjoyed it. It is our new "special occasion" place. Tuesday's visit was for our 13th anniversary. Staff is awesome, ambiance is nice and laid back. They even brought out a special treat to recognize our anniversary. Great place. Nice menu. Really solid options that are always very well prepared and nicely presented. I tried a random glass of pinot and it was excellent. I would go back here anytime.
Awesome food and service! Will Definitely be back!

column4: 88 West Paces Ferry Road Atlanta, GA  30305
column13: We celebrated my birthday and it was just a wonderful evening.

First visit and we were treated special! Began with fried green tomato appetizer (classic and good!), then enjoyed the ribeye topped with 'bacon jam' and boursin accompanied by brussell sprouts (steak melted in your mouth and brussell sprouts were worth a return trip in themselves!). My husband had the New York Strip special. Steak was a bit tough but cooked to perfect temperature, and the root vegetables were perfect.Had the beignets....not comparable to Cafe Du Monde's but tasty.We'll be back!

column4: 794 N. Highland Ave. NE Atlanta, GA  30306
column13: My boyfriend had a great time. Great food and drinks. The ambiance is very casual and the menu had so much yummy goodness to choose from. We will return.
We were allowed plenty of time to visit with our friends before ordering and after eating as well. Attentive service but not hovering. Food was nicely presented and very flavorful.

We had lunch here, a friend and I, as part of the Midtown Restaurant Week. I had heard the food is always very good here so wanted to sample it. Pretty much the food was wonderful, nothing really unique (sort of stereotypical French fare), but very well done. I was disappointed they had run out of the creme brulee by the time I came to order my dessert (a French restaurant that runs out of Creme Brulee, really?) but the french vanilla ice cream dessert I ordered instead was delicious.Our server was very friendly and offered me a top wine recommendation, based on what I had told her. I found we waited a little long in between courses (I mean it was a 1.5 hour lunch) but the food more than made up for any shortfall. Nice "atmosphere" too
My boyfriend went Sunday for an early romantic dinner. We had a reservation and were seated quickly. We had a wonderful time and the food was excellent! We will be going back.
Great service, nice wine selection. Food was very fresh and well prepared. Would definitely return.

We had a nice meal at Azul Agave. All of the food was very good to excellent -- guacamole made at the table, various tacos and other main courses were delicious except the carne asada tacos, which were a bit dry. Our waitress had a few too many tables to deal with, but she did a great job considering the crowd, had a nice personality and we were not in a rush. Best margarita I have had in the Alpharetta area and beautiful interior to the restaurant. We liked it a lot and will return.

The shrimp and grits app was really good. The ribeye was amazing. Great selection of specialty cocktails. Great service. We really enjoyed the keyboard player. Many of the restaurants around town were booked so we tried B Mathews and were very impressed and recommend.

column4: 573 North Highland Avenue NE Atlanta, GA  30307
column13: Babette's Cafe is my wife's and my favorite neighborhood restaurant. The food is always excellent, the people are wonderful, and the place is classic Virginia Highlands charm. It is always a treat, and a favorite for special occasions.
Very good food, but GREAT service. Lively atomosphere in a well-planned space.
They were out of many items on the night we attended, which definitely didn't go over well with the group.But the ambiance was nice, I think it's a great place for drinks and happy hour!

Set apart from Buckhead busy street traffic this setting blends a most unique combination of outdoor/patio natural views and inward rooms dressed with rich colors and tastefully appealing art-- live music by a gifted Brazilian musician caresses the ambiance of the entire space that serves all. The menu choices have always complemented all flavors youhope to experience from tapas and appetizers, entrees and desert. Love their house pinot noir. And they will accommodate most any combo of menu choices to self-style a creative flair desire. All for modest costs.Very romantic special place with the best personal service you could want.Always a favorite due to the cordial staff's effort to make every aspect of dininga multi-sense jo

We used to go to the Bees Knees a lot, and hadn't been in a while. Since we've been, it seems that they are trying to save money by doing their menu items differently. Some of the menu items were still good, but others were greatly different. The Avocado Chop Chop is now made with shrimp instead of crab and the Japanese aoli was almost non-existent. It really was disappointing. The Panang curry was much drier than it has been before also- it just overall was disappointing.

column4: 315 W. St. Julian Street Savannah, GA  31401
column13: Excellent menu and food was delicious. Staff was friendly and knowledgable.
I found this restaurant to be great, the food, all of it was excellent, service was great, looking forward to going back

We are a group of 4 adults and 4 kids and always go out together. Benihana is one of our favorite places and our kids definitely love it. I like the fact that the cooks have so much patience and are nice with them answering all their questions and not only making it fun for us but for for them as well.
That was the Best Birthday ever and the service was great.
It's great to see your food prepared right in front of you. This is fun especially when you have a group of 10 people to fill up a table.

The dinner vibe was a cross between a bar style with TV and a romantic setting. Too much noise for a steakhouse with only three tables full there was no need to ruin the experience with tv dinner show. Otherwise, shrimp was slighty overcooked and fish special waz ok. Has potential to be a much better restaurant.

column4: One Galleria Parkway Suite 1B1 Atlanta, GA  30339
column13: Great for groups and new experinces!

Excellent service and atmosphere. The food was delicious. The caramelized onion rings that came with my braised pork were the best I've ever had. While the pork was tasty, I would have preferred half the amount of meat with vegetables in its place, as the only vegetable was the onion.
Everything was absolutely outstanding!!! What a wonderful gem!!!

We really enjoyed our dinner for our anniversary, and appreciated our special dessert - a lovely touch. We also much preferred our seating in a quieter room instead of the very noisy main dining room. Our meal was delicious!
We waited one hour for our entree to be served ...lots of excuses.. When food came, scallops were overfilled and both meals were Luke warm. Did comp us dessert, I would not go back.

column4: 4686 S Atlanta Rd SE Smyrna, GA  30080
column13: great service---very good food--moderate prices

column4: 45 Ivan Allen Jr Boulevard NW W Hotel - Downtown Atlanta Atlanta, GA  30308
column13: BLT all the way! I had dinner here and loved everything! Everything was wonderful, from the complimentary popover bread to the bone in ribeye. Service was very helpful and professional. Our server recommended the tuna tartare which was amazing, as was the beet salad that I ordered. My friend and I split the 20oz bone in in ribeye and loaded up on sides. Mac and cheese with bacon and truffle is a must! If you have room for dessert, get the peanut butter parfait. It's mind blowing.

column1: Blue Grotto Sushi and Tapas - Sandy Springs
column4: 220 Sandy Springs Circle Suite 205 Sandy Springs, GA  30328
column13: Food was awesome â€“ the mussels are a must have. Atmosphere was perfect. Really nice dining experience.

The food was delicious which made up for our poor service. Our waiter could never be found and we had a group of 7 so we figured he knew he was getting automatic gratuity which is why he slacked off on his job. The Falcons (tempura sushi roll) and the fried rice were wonderful. The Big Chicago was also good but I wouldn't ay its one of their best offerings. I look forward to going there again.

The only bad thing about Boar's Head Tavern is that now I am spoiled by their shrimp and grits and know that I will never find this dish made anywhere better - it was that good! We also had the Georgia Hot Brown sandwich, and it was really good too. For an appetizer, we split the barbeque shrimp and the shrimp were plump, juicy, sweet and perfectly cooked. The staff work well together as a team - probably better than I have seen in any restaurant. They have an open kitchen, so you can see this teamwork better than you can when you only get to observe the front of the house and wait staff. We just loved everything about the Boars Head Tavern. It was referred to us from a B&B Manager and we would have thought to come here on our own.
Small but excellent menu. Good wine/beer list. Excellent service. Great for before theater/symphony. Love the small menu. Something for everyone and everything is prepared so well.

Our order consisted of: fried green tomatoes, apple topped chops with a house salad, Havana chicken with potato soup, & strawberry cake.The fgt were good, but nothing to rave about. The tomatoes would have been better with more crisp & if they were homegrown! House salad & potato soup arrived after the main meal, so this was barely touched. The apple pork chops with feta and Havana chicken was really good & moist, but not much of it!!As for the environment, I didn't like it. It had so much more potential. The booths are very bad seating. I ended up leaning against the far wall just to keep comfortable. If you go here, stay away from the booths or bring a pillow!
Bones is by far, one of the best traditional, upscale Steakhouses in Atlanta.

One of the most original menus in Savannah. The atmosphere is relaxed as you would expect from a brasserie. But the food is a lot better than you would find in most French brasseries. I know, I'm French!

The restaurant had a moderate crowd for a weekday evening. The bar was full and there were a few open tables in the dining area when we arrived. When we were seated there was a large handful of food remnants on the seat which the hostess noticed and left for me to wipe away. The sever quickly greeted us and took our drink order which he promptly got wrong. The Lemone Chicken looked good on the plate but lacked any flavor and the accompanying vegetables were very al dente to the point I wondered if they ever saw the inside of a pan. I ordered the dessert that came with the meal to go. Once home I discovered that they had given me the wrong dessert. I will not be coming back anytime soon.
EXCELLENT STAFF,FROM THE FRONT DOOR TO THE TABLE. NICE JOB.THANK YOU.

This was the perfect place for a business meeting. My guest was impressed. The decor was modern and the seating very comfortable. The presentation of our meal was elegant. The food was fantastic. I can't wait to go back for a non-business night out. There was a guitarist playing in the background which added to the ambiance, but never disturbed our conversation.

column4: 220 Sandy Springs Circle #101 Sandy Springs, GA  30328
column13: We sat outside on an enclosed porch and though it was a little difficult to get to our table, it was SO much quieter than inside. A little surprised that there was a charge for bread - especially since it was nothing special. The wine I ordered was not available, but an alternative was offered. The food was delicious.

column4: 6010 B1 Sandy Springs Circle Sandy Springs, GA  30328
column13: Great place for a business lunch. Waitstaff is helpful nut unobtrusive. Sandwiches are very good and soup and salad combos rock.

column4: 705  Town Blvd, Suite Q330 Atlanta, GA  30319
column13: Even with a reservation it took a long time to get seated. It was clear from the beginning that they were having issues that night. They seated us by the door and host stand. After 20 minutes someone finally took a drink order. After another 15 minutes they came by to say that the bartender was working on the drinks and it would be five more minutes. That was our first time speaking with the manager. She said things would get better. They did not. Our food took a long time, did not all come out at the same time, but was very good when we did get it. They need to improve their service to match their food. Also, work on improving the 87 rating they had on their inspection certificate. They did end up comping our drinks and reducing the bi
Good food, huge portions. I would definitely eat here again. Very close experience to other Italian chain restaurants, which I usually enjoy.
The Buckhead Diner has retained its excellent food & vibrant atmosphere for a long time.

We waited 20 minutes before receiving menus. Another 15 minutes passed before anyone took our order. Food arrived after another 20 minutes. We had to find someone to ask for our check. Clearly understaffed on this day.
Excellent service and excellent quality food. Pricey ala carte but worth it!

Great food and service. Staff was excellent; extremely professional and attentive. The patio has a great feel and the lighting is perfect. Only complaint would be that the chairs are a little uncomfortable.

column1: The Café at The Ritz-Carlton Buckhead
column13: The food was good, the selection of food used to be better. They were quite acommodating with special requests.
We went early, and it was empty. Great decor and setting. Rooftop was very nice, but small. Not a very diverse cliente, but everyone was friendly, nice, and appropriately behaved and dressed.
The food was very good. My husband and I shared a Panni sandwhich, which worked out great. Nice atmosphere, very relaxing on a beautiful day. Would come again.

column4: 3280 Peachtree Road NE Suite 150 Atlanta, GA  30305
column13: just nothing outstanding about it. accomodated our group well overall. service was slow. food was that of regular neighborhood mexican more than atlanta upscale mexican. wasnt very special.

column4: 255 East Paces Ferry Road Atlanta, GA  30305
column13: This restaurant is very elegant in an old school, good way. We were greeted very graciously, by name, by the hostess. The rest of the staff was very attentive as well, without being condescending. The food was delicious; the portions are generous. There is a lovely view of the skyline at night.

we had a group of 4 in our party and it was the first time at this restaurant. The food was very good and Quinton our waiter was very attentive. We went during lunch and was happy that you were able to carry on a conversation and hear your other guests without shouting. The tables were not on top of each other so you were not overhearing your neighbors talking. They were very thoughtful and brought everyone a glass of champagne and a rose for the ladies to celebrate our first time at the restaurant.

Our food was very good--the service was slow-we had our bread for at leat 10 minutes before we even got our bottle of wine--we were never offered any water once we received out first glass--however they were ver accomidating with the menu--I did not see exactly what I wanted so the chef prepared for me-the serving are large--2-3 people can definately share.

We really wanted to LOVE this place. Walked in to a very inviting atmospere and we greated by the host (owner?). The bar looks inviting and it was a beautiful space. Alas, the kitchen didn't match the front end of the house. The ceasar salad came out weirdly acidic with not a hint of creaminess or anchovy - althought they did split it for my companion and I and it lookly very appealing on the plate. The pasta with artichoke & mushroom with chicken was just bland, bland and the pasta came out of a box. My companion's halibut over risotto looked and tasted overcooked and past it's prime. I might go back and meet a friend at the bar, grab a glass of wine and try an appetizer but don't think it's on my "regulars" list. Too bad.
This was my wife and I second visit here and we absolutely love it. The filet is awesome. The atmosphere is awesome. We will definitely be going back.
Food was excellent and service was outstanding. We enjoyed the Krispy Kreme bread pudding, very unique. There were several large groups there that night and it made it quite noisy.

The Cellar was very good! It was a full house and therefore a bit loud but it didn't bother us. Everything we ordered was delicious...service was a bit slow but again, they were very busy so it was understandable.
We had a great meal and wonderful service. I highly recommend the Chart House to any and everyone who likes great food and atmosphere in the hear of River Street.

column4: 236 Perimeter Center Pkwy NE Atlanta, GA  30346
column13: The Chipolte Shrimp appetizer was delicious! Also, the scallops were exceptional.
Escargot is one of the best! Ordered the Prime Rib and the Pecan Crusted Chicken....very satisfied with both.

Fourth time at the CE and we have yet to be disappointed. First, our wait staff was attentative and kept us informed of the status of our order, refilling water, etc...there was a huge prom group the night of our visit and the staff was up to the challenge. Food was, hot, tasty and on time. We enjoy the CE as our emerging new favorite.

column4: 70 W Paces Ferry Rd Atlanta, GA  30305
column13: This was my second visit to Chops. The lamb chops were really great.Edward provided excellent service and helpful information to all of us.Will definitely go back again son.

column4: 70 W Paces Ferry Rd Atlanta, GA  30305
column13: Food lacked luster. We had the appetizer special, crab claws, they were very good. Outside of that the food was little better than average. With so many great restaruants in Atlanta I would recommend for a foodie to head down to Rathbun's Steak or even North to Fleming's. If it's just an Atlanta staple you are looking to check off your list, hit Chops up. While you're there be sure to get a nice bottle of wine and make the experience worth it!
Great place for higher quality Mexican food.

Cinco really does it well. The decor is very trendy, upscale yet casual. They have a wide variety of tacos, enchiladas and burritos, but also choices of adventurous go unmet dishes. My wife had very good grilled soft tacos while I had a dish called Pollo Pakal. Pollo Pakal was a layer of chicken chipotle peppers, shells, with a cream corn sauce. Outstanding.

We had a nice quiet brunch. The breakfast burrito, scrambled eggs and chorizo in a flour tortilla, was delicious. The potato fries made an excellent side. They also still carry their normal lunch menu, which hubby and daughter stuck to, during this time.

Went in for an anniversary and asked for a secluded table and private area. We were placed in the back in an open area. They seemed to forget about us and the glass of water I got only got filled one time and that was near the end of dinner...that was the only time she really came by. Not impressed.
Food and service were excellent
Need patio heaters to keep the outside area viable thoughout winter

Staff was extremely attentive. Food was very good - we ordered Crab cake and goi salad as appetizers, pandan rice with grilled shrimp, shaking beef, and grilled chicken and shrimp satay. We liked crab cake very much, as well as goi salad (not as spicy as Thai places around town) and shaking beef.
My family loves dining at Copeland's Cheesecake Bistro! The food and service is always A-1!

column4: 44 Martin Luther King Blvd. Savannah, GA  31401
column13: The food was good, however the chicken parmesman was over powered by too much sauce and too little pasta! Noted on other plates while exiting the restaurant they had more. Perhaps if they cooked too little they should have waited and prepared more to serve! It's Italian so should have pasta!
Great restuarant for brunch on a Saturday or Sunday. Had the Grilled Skirt steak and eggs benedict. Was delicious.Sampled others selections, all wwere tasty. Great service.

column1: Courtyard at Crane - Jekyll Island Club Hotel
column13: This was a big disappointment. Our waiter had very little enthusiasm; not what we expected from a server at the Jekyll Island Club. Our meals had very little taste, and the overall experience was less than memorable. We will never go back, and I would definitely not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Groin food. As usual the rainbow cake was awesome We are from Durham and we always make this our first night in Atlanta stop.
Always great foos, great Bloody Marys & Mimosas on Sunday.

On my first visit to this restaurant we both ordered specials and sat outside. It's a great spot on Peachtree. Lots of light and activity without too much noise due to the wide side walks. I don't know what the regular menu food is like but the specials were really great. It is a great neighborhood spot to walk to also.

column4: 1401 Strand Avenue Tybee Island-Savannah Beach, GA  31328
column13: We were from out of town. My mapquest directions were very easy to follow. It was easy to find. Reservations were very easy to make online. We went there for my husband's birthday. He said the food was great (oysters, steak, and shrimp). Beautiful scenary through your large picturesque windows. Staff was very hospitable. Our waitress was superb. She surprised my husband with a beautifully decorated chocolate lava cake dessert "on the house". We were very pleased with the whole experience.
Double Zero is always quite good.

Great food, but wish the serving portions were not so huge. The pork chops are delicious and we each had one whole chop to take home, but I would rather pay less than the high prices for the entrees and have half the portion. That way my husband and I could try more entrees. Small plates would be a wonderful feature to add to the menu.
Great food, accommodating service, and reasonably priced. I was very impressed and plan to make this a favorite!
Great restaurant. My date is new to Atlanta and she really enjoyed teh experience. Excellent service.

The Syreet noise, as we where seated outside on the corner next to the side walk with the harsh street lights was jarring and not pleasant, we needed sunglasses and ear plugs, not Romantic. All else was GOOD...
All was perfect with the exception of the service. It was slow. We were with a 2 1/2 year old and waiting too long for the food makes the experience a little stressful.

Very tasty dinner with an interesting set of pretty people at the bar scene.Love to see when the chef's table is opening up. This was perfect for the pace , the quality of the dinner and the ambiance. I will be back.

This is where you want to come for a quiet and relaxing dinner in the ambianece of a beautiful home. The wait staff is very knowledgeable and the food very well prepared and presented. Service was a little rushed but I would prefer that over being drawn out too long. If you are staying in the historica district, do yourself a favor and take a cap. They are inexpensive at about $6 each way and you wont have to worry about parking nor the drive back.

I'm writing this review on a past experience to Enat since they were not open when I went for lunch this past Thursday. The woman who owns the restaurant is very nice and accomodating. I definitely enjoyed my first experience at an Ethiopian restaurant. Its a quaint unassuming building. The food was great and I would definitely come back. Just note to all those interested, they are only open for dinner.
Typical bar menu but good eats for the price.

Excellent venue for an even more outstanding meal. The waiter was informative and made recommendations which proved to be accurate. The Lasagne was truly remarkable and next trip I will try the Lobster Ravioli which appeared to be smothered in sizable pieces of Lobster. I have added this to my list of restaurants in the ATL for great Italian cuisine.

column4: 367 Bishop Chapel Church Road Swainsboro, GA  30401
column13: A unique and welcome change of pace hidden in Swainsboro, GA.Excellent food, great ambiance and all at reasonable prices

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Atlanta
column13: Another great find on open table. Service was unbelievable. Wine list was exhausting.. Food was incredible!
I had high expectations, but I found the food, the service, and the overall experience just average. I did not dislike it, but I did not love it. I would go again.

Spooky decor - just for Halloween. Loved it. The service was great (as always) and the food over the moon. Had an amazing salad with goat cheese, pecans and red pears. The entree (seared scallops) was cooked perfectly. I'll be back.

I used to go to Founders a fair bit after it first opened. I love the building and the bar and the food was pretty good considering you are outside of Atlanta. About a year ago I had a really bad meal and emailed the management about it. They never responded. I went back last week because I heard they had hired a new chef and that the food had gotten better. I will say that the food was cooked better but the product seemed inferior. I had the filet and the texture and taste of the beef seemed more like grocery store quality than restaurant quality. That said, the other components were also well cooked. I hope this place gets it together becaue it could and should be an iconic southside restaurant.
the food is good most is great, I think I have experienced 80% of the menu, snapper is yum, crab cakes are good, those honey hot wings grilled are super young. Fish tacos are yummy
It was the perfect place for a schmooze evening with the boss.

Was not very busy on a weeknight. Nice space inside, good menu with good prices. The sushi came out quickly and was good, but not amazing. I'm wondering if this place is going to make it. It has such potential, but something is missing...

We had a truly wonderful time. I had seen the advertisements for the inn in local magazines and was rather intrigued by it. My wife and I love the north Georgia mountain part of the state, and so with this recent trip...I thought it would be the perfect spot to take her for her birthday. Thank you to the staff for making it such a special and enjoyable time!
Have been previously. Always great food, atmosphere, service and location. Excellent spot for "date night"!!!

I had a large group (11) for a birthday party. This was a great place for it. Good location. Good price. Good service. All the food came out on time. The server easily split the check. We all had fun.
Good location. Differnt. lot on the menu.

column1: Grand Dining Room at the Jekyll Island Club Hotel
column13: A grand southern brunch. A beautiful, historic Queen Anne setting. Attentive service. What more could a person ask for?

We went during the Grand Opening week. The entire staff was extremely friendly and attentive, especially the Hibachi chef, who was witty and friendly and talented. The sushi was good, the hibachi food was excellent. Overall it was a very pleasant experience. The only negative was the 80's dance music blaring from the overhead speakers. I feel quite certain that the staff would have been more than happy to turn it down/off if we had asked. The overall ambiance could use a little help, in fact.

This was my first experience at Halyards. I have eaten several times at the Cloister but would easily recommend Halyards over The Cloister and Coastal Kitchen, the two other fine dining offerings on Saint Simons.

Haven was a delicious Sunday night dinner option. All four salads were tasty and creatively done. Our entrees (grouper, salmon, pork chop, and gumbo) were also excellent. The waiter executed every special request perfectly (and this has been a challenge at most restaurants, lately). Thank you, Haven staff!
The scary rhing is the served 4 tables including us on Saturday night between 7-10the pm.
Love this restaurant!! It's our" go to" place for any occasion, or no occasion at all!!

This was our first time to Hudson Grill and it was amazing!!!! We started off with the Corn Lobster dip which was OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!! You must try even if you are not a big seafood person. The waitress was training both were very knowledgable about the menu and the specials of the day. We had a few beers and gave us a few samples of ones we had not tried before. We had the wings, I had the boneless and my husband had the bone in which were huge Anchor Bar wings. We both got the 10 piece and could not finish all of them. We are looking forward to coming back and trying everything on the menu!!!!!
ALways good food, fun atmosphere
I met a former colleague for a catch-up lunch. We sat outside since the day was beautiful.
Monday night is 5$ hamburger night...be there or be square!
Food and service is very very special here. Can't wait to go back.
we had a great time.people at the rest. were fantasticdennis
Jessie did a great job taking care of us. Fall in ATL is amazing and Joe's is the perfect patio place to enjoy it. We'll be back.
The food was bad, the service was horrible!

column4: 5600 Roswell Road NE, M011 Atlanta, GA  30342
column13: We have been coming to Kobe since we had our Wedding Dinner there, 15 years ago. It is always a very special place for us and will continue to be that in the future. We love everything about the experience and yes, that is what it always is!Thanks to all who have served us!

column4: 3305 Peachtree Ind Blvd suite 100 Duluth, GA  30096
column13: We dined on a Monday night before a show so the restaurant was quiet. We enjoyed the food and beer selections, found the prices to be in line and generally had a good meal.
Great food; friendly and knowledgeable staff

Wonderful food, excellent service, and perfect weather for dining on the patio - what more could you ask for?Our server was efficient, knowledgeable, and most helpful, without being intrusive. There were six of us in our party, everyone ordered a different entree, and there wasn't a complaint in the bunch. Everyone agreed that LaCasa was definitely a favorite and worth frequent repeats.

The restaurant was only half full and the food took about an hour to reach our table, and that was after our waiter said 30 minutes in that it "should be out in about 5 minutes". I had ordered the rabbit fricasse and it was way overcooked and tough, indistinguishable as rabbit. The other order was for the chicken, which was quite tasty. A complentary non-descript creme brule as a token of their appreciation for waiting an hour for the food was less than acceptable.
Very pleased with my first experience at La Petite Maison. The staff were so pleasant and the food was delicious. I was pleased with the portion sizes as well.

We had early dinner reservations so we could make it to a show at the Ansley Playhouse across the hall. Traffic was very heavy making it hard to get to the restaurant and to park. Food was very tasty, but used a lot of salt that made all of us feel poorly the next day. Service was very good. Wine a little pricy. Great appetizer and dessert.

Once again, great food, great service, well priced. Their Sunday night lasagna is the one by which I judge all others. I donâ€™t know if as Atlanta becomes more and more of a competitive food city that we are becoming harder to please? Because I come away more often than ever, meh! But La Tavola always pleases.

Since the Lake Rabun Restaurant is almost the only gig in town, it is difficult to knock it. Unfortunately my guests and myself went their with high expectations after we had reviewed the menu online and in the end were all disappointed. All four of us ordered something different and sadly none of us were impressed with our meal. Our general observation was that all main courses were VERY SALTY. In addition our salads were all dry and under-dressed and a big yawn. I had been to the restaurant 2 times prior and had good experiences. My hope is that the chef was just not on his A game that evening. I am willing to give it another try.
Great delicious french food by Owner and Chef Remy Kerba.

The restaurant was very crowded as it usually is on the night of a theatre performance. But not usual was the service - very slow and the server had too many tables. The manager was actually on the floor serving. After awhile, the manager came to tell us there was a mix up with our order, but it would be coming soon. Ten minutes later it did come, but the trout was NOT cooked on one side. I ate the other side before I realized the situation. It was too late to send it back, because we were going to the theatre and the meal had taken so long to come out. When presented with the bill, we complained to the server. The manager came over and graciously took the fish off the bill and then to further apologize, he took off the appetizer.
Loca Luna is a Very Nice Place to be for Any Occassion, the Food was Great Customer Service was Wonderful!

Our first experience and we were with out of town guests. They loved it and we had a great time. Our server, Carson did an outstanding job letting us pace the meal and also helping with wine pairing. Back room was a little dark, but overall ambiance was very nice. We will be back!

Went for brunch, and it was probably the best I've ever had. Wide variety of unique and delicious foods. All you can eat brunch full of unique dishes!! You walk through the kitchen to get your continuously freshly made food.

we have eaten at Luciano's several times previously and it is always excellent. This time we took an employee and his fiancee for a celebratory dinner. Luciano's pulled out all the stops - starting with a champange toast and ending with a complimentary deserts.Our service was great, making for a superb dining experience.

Although this is the location of the now " just memories" Vickery's ( which I miss very much), it is nothing like it- the decor is so outstanding- the scallops were delicious and our server Brian took his time with each table to make you feel very special- went on a Sunday night which made it that much more delightful- not a large crowd and nice and quiet- will be back that's for sure!!!

Family style dining is the only way to go. We had a total of 6 adults, 2 children, and 1 infant and EVERYONE ate until they could eat no more... We were celebrating my birthday with our children and grandchildren. I wouldn't hesitate doing it again. Thank you for such a wonderful time. Mark D

column4: 1601 Cumberland Mall SE Suite 200 Atlanta, GA  30339
column13: Excellent restaurant, good food, great staff, they are friendly and very polite...

column4: 4400 Ashford Dunwoody Road Space # 3035 Atlanta, GA  30346
column13: My BFF and I had been visiting Cheesecake factory down the block for the past few months with horrible service results; after this Saturday's experience with Maggiano's..will not return to Cheesecake Factory for anything; not even their better cheesecake; the service at Maggiano's is enough to deter any temptation Cheesecake Factory has. The desert I ordered was cheesecake from Maggiano's and it is a bit grainy and not nearly as sweet as I prefer; however, the service, attention to detail, the team-approach to meeting our needs and anticipate our wishes (refills) was awesome!

We arrived for the Sunday brunch buffet later in the afternoon. Food selection and quality was great. Our server, however, was not-so-great. The server was not friendly, did not explain things to those "first-timers" in our party of 4, did not clear our plates timely, let our water glasses run dry, and actually bumped two of us with our plates when he did clear them!

As usual, Manuel's surpasses all expectation! Seven of us dined outside and enjoyed every moment. When it started to get chilly the staff turned on heaters for us and provided blankets! The heaters gave off a red light, giving us a nifty ambiance for dinner. From the wine and beer to the appetizers and main course, all the way to dessert, everyone was (as usual!) astonished at the amazing quality of our meal. We often complained during the meal that we only wish we had more and even more to take home with us! (The portions are fine, weâ€™re just greedy) We struggled to choose between their various specials, they all sounded wonderful! When dessert came we all ordered various half-slice platters of cake, being as we simply could not choose.

This certainly must be one of the better restaurants in Macon. We were only in town for a few days and had a difficult time finding a restaurant we really liked until we found Marco's. We also thought the staff was very friendly and attentive - thank you Marco's : )
Food was not very good. Wine was terrible, bottle had turned. Service and atmosphere very good.

Things I liked: they were happy to accommodate us when we showed up with additional people beyond our reservation (met some other friends in the hotel lobby, and, well...). Best: The ribs were quite tasty with a nice blend of heat and sweet (although there was a minority opinion that they were too sweet) and cooked just about perfectly--tender and smoky but still good texture. Steak was also very good. Nice selection of their own beers--the Alternate Ryeality and the Imperial Mocha Oatmeal Stout were standouts. Side note: I came back later in the week and can also vouch for the very good Abbey Belgian. Less positive: the food was slow (very busy night). One burger came out undercooked (but the problem was quickly and satisfactorily fixed).

Very disappointed with our dining experience !Have dined at this restaurant many timesAnd ALWAYS gave positive feedback!Unfortunately this was not the case Saturdaynight!The food was very disappointing.... Salmonin phyllo dough had a greasy fishy taste!Two of us ordered this and both agreed!The walnut blue cheese salad had no flavor...Spinach, a few blue cheese crumbles andA FEW nuts on top... Flavorless!The ambiance was perfect.... Our waiterExtremely polite and cordial ! HoweverHe brought us our bill and never asked ifWe were interested in ordering dessert!We even told hostess we were celebrating aBirthday!I am hoping this was just an "off" night andOur next dining experience will be what weare accus
Enjoyed the accommodation & atmosphere. I will be back soon.

Genuinely hearty tavern food: all the favorites. Went for the first time tonight (Thursday), and the place was full by 7:00 (hint: make an Open Table reservation). Prices were moderate, and portions are huge. A worthy destination if you're in the Lawrenceville/Duluth portion of Gwinnett County.

Was in town for Cowboys game and hotel data recommended for a great steak. Didn't disappoint. Prices were reasonable for upscale. Manager and wait staff excellent. Great atmosphere. Would dine again. Ask for server Mark.

column4: 5710 State Bridge Rd. Johns Creek, GA  30097
column13: Beautiful restaurant replete w/piano bar. Bar is a nice place to have a drink.

Service was great, food was great. What wasn't so great was the kitchen banging against the wall we were sitting at. Several times during our meal the kitchen, on the other side of our booth wall, literally had the wall moving. If you go, don't let them seat you in the very back corner on the raised platform.

column4: 2500 Cobb Place Lane NW Kennesaw, GA  30144
column13: We love the Melting Pot, and it's our go-to restaurant for quiet nights out without the kids.

We always think of the Melting Pot for our anniversary celebration, as well as birthdays. They provide a quiet, intimate dining experience. The 4-course classic option is the way to go. We have never been disappointed.
We never fail to have a wonderful time when we come here

My wife and I had a fantastic date night at the Meritage. In Columbus, "fine dining" is usually used to describe the Olive Garden or some other massive chain restaurant. The Meritage actually is fine dining. Delicious food, great service and an amazing wine list. This place ranks in my top 5 dining experiences and I have eaten at great restaurants all over the US. We will definitely be going back!

Fabulous food and Mark was a delightful server. Also, Daniel stopped by to help us with the wine selection. The staff at Miller Union is truly knowledgeable about the food, including preparation nuances. All of this is done with grace and no "attitude". Very refreshing!

Our recent experience was certainly better than the previous visit. At least we were served with a bread basket this time. Service generally was improved, the appetisers were good, as were our entrees. But something is still lacking - it's just not the 'special place' it once was.
It was really good..Service was excellent and people are so friendly..Server actually explained us the whole menu..also the Persian ice cream is so yummy..
Wonderful staff! So pleasant and helpful.

The name may make you think it's a Japanese restaurant but it's definitely Italian! It was well worth the drive from Atlanta. Each of the four sauces that we tried were superb as were the hand-made pastas, especially the apple, sage and sausage ravioli.

Visited Moon River Brewing Company while in town for the Rock N Roll Savannah Marathon and chose the restaurant based upon the "vegan friendly" reviews. Unfortunately, we found that the restaurant was operating on a limited menu which did not include vegan options. Our superb server did help the 2 veg people in our party to cobble together a couple of options, but I have to say that I was looking forward to having a few real choices.FYI: Runners do eat a lot, but some of us like to eat lots of non-dairy, non-meat options.The omnivores in our party thoroughly enjoyed their meals!

column4: 303 Peachtree Center Avenue SunTrust Plaza Building Atlanta, GA  30308
column13: The Kitchen was Very Slow that night. Our waiter was OUTSTANDING, and the steaks were just a little above average.I have cut meat my whole life and it appeared to me my 22oz Ribeye was cut a little short on the weight. One of the Gentlemen with me had a grisel in his steak he could not even cut through with the knife provided.I have been to several of the top Steak House's in the Atlanta area and I was not impressed with my Vist to Morton's. I am sorry, but you asked!
This was my second time dining her but my boyfriends first. We used our scoutmob coupon and was thrilled with the service and food.
Enjoyed our business lunch and service. Recommend.

My favorite menu items are no longer available and the expansipn is a real disappointment. The "speakeasy" format is nothing more than a gimmick and is too dark to easily read the menu. I think they missed a great opportunity to simply enlarge the old format. I have no idea why they spent so much money on cooler doors and one way mirrors... Maybe they were trying to impress their friends in the business, but it sure doesn't impress me or my friends.
Friendly staff and excellent service. Variety of delicious entrees and desserts! Cheesecake Baklava is the best!!!

Atlanta has a few really good Thai restaurants, but we do not think any are better than Nahm. The food is always fresh, creative, and excellent. The room is handsome and the atmosphere is warm, largely because all the people who work at Nahm are so incredibly nice. When Chef Nahm is there she personally welcomes each table at some point during the evening, and even on the rare occasions she is not there, the rest of her staff make you feel as though you are guests in their home. Highly recommended.
Came on first date, food and service was very good and would definitely come back.

column1: Nakato Japanese Restaurant - Traditional Dining and Sushi Bar
column13: Always excellent Sushi and Sashimi
This is a marvelous high-end Thai restaurant with dishes you won't find anywhere else. Service was excellent on our recent visit -- attentive but not intrusive. Good wine list and cocktails as well.

column4: 3424 Peachtree Road NE Suite 100 Atlanta, GA  30326
column13: Extraordinary experience. The filet melts in your mouth. Service was fabulous, constantly referred to as Mr./Mrs. They have several booths which I would recommend requesting for a special occasion. We mentioned it was our anniversary and received a nice card and complimentary dessert.

column4: Hilton Atlanta 255 Courtland Street, NE 30th Floor Atlanta, GA  30303
column13: This is my favorite restaurant in Atlanta! The food is delicious and "plated" beautifully, and the service is impeccable! Make sure you order the lamb entree... Not to be missed!!!

Nino's is an excellent restaurant. We had reservations and were immediately seated in a nice corner table for the 5 people in our group. The wait staff was courteous and attentive, we had plenty of bread, wine, and appetizers quickly. The main courses were delicious, especially the Pasta con carciofi e capesante and the Vitello gorgonzola. With two bottles of wine, dinner for 5 came to about $250, which is very reasonable for such an excellent night out. We're regulars at Nino's and of course we'll be back!

Really disappointing. NM cafe seems to have gone seriously downhill. The service was inattentive and the food was sub-standard. The she-crab soup was still good, but the salads and sandwiches were very poor.

column4: 129 E. Ponce De Leon Ave. Decatur, GA  33030
column13: Excellent as always. Sat outside and the noise level was very tolerable!
Awesome experience. My wife and I had a great time and the food was to die for. Would definitely recommend the duck for entree.

I have celebrated my birthday at Noche- Virgina Highlands for the past two years! I have thoroughly enjoyed myself each time! The food was impeccable, the ambiance was perfect! I would definitely recommend this setting to my friends, strangers, anybody!!! I will return....I just won't wait so long until next time! :-)
Food was good. A little overpriced on the beverages. Try and get outside
Wonderful restaurant! The food was great and the portions were generous.

Great fried oysters and grilled fish was good, but Grilled shrimp over cooked, Fried shrimp very over breaded...couldn't even taste the shrimp; Fries just OK; Fried cod was unimpressive; staff was very friendly, but was not knowledgeable/empowered (reflection on training/mgmt); Management did not engage with customers; Parking is $5/hr beyond first hour;
Great experience! Food, staff and service were all top notch!
Have not been disappointed on any of our visits. Probably our favorite find in the last year since moving to Atlanta.

Probably the best gumbo I have ever had. My wife ordered the scallops, but it didn't come any sides, i.e. vegetables, etc. kind of a bummer for a $28 plate. The food was delicious though. Would recommend.
Our waiter was a gem, and the food was delicious and attractively served. If I didn't live out of town, I definitely would go back often!

Our party of four enjoyed a Saturday night dinner of various dishes. We did not order any appetizers, but all had side salads, these amply sized, served cold and crisp. All entrees were pasta-based or had a pasta accompaniment, but the portion size of the protein in the pasta-based dish ordered by one of our women diners was noted as being too small.

column4: 3391 Peachtree Road, NE At the Westin Buckhead Atlanta, GA  30326
column13: We are regular visitors to the Palm in Buckhead and have been for many years. We know that the food will always be great and the people very accomodating. We were shopping at the Perimeter and in Buckhead and scheduled lunch at the Palm. It was the first time we had tried the Businessman's lunch and it was great. Good selections and more than you could eat for a great price. We are also 837 club members and have been since years ago when we lived in Tampa, Fl and went to the Palm there....same great service and food. We will be going to NY next month and plan to try the Palm One!!

column4: 10970-A State Bridge Rd. Johns Creek, GA  30022
column13: Not a great place but a good place. However, comparing to other choices I would probably not go back here. A little expensive. Fried Lobster tail was made more like chicken fingers. Truffle Potatos were not very good. Mushrooms were the best thing we had. Staff was nice. Steaks were good but not great. Wine pour seemed a bit light compared to other places.

Park CafÃ© was the perfect restaurant for entertaining my out-of-town guests, giving them a fusion of Southern taste with a kicked-up French bistro fare. From our concierge Aaron, who offered a wealth of wine expertise- to our server Adam, who was the perfect liaison between food courses. The most notable gem of the restaurant is, by far, the food. Chef Tiffany, the culinary artist behind our delectable menu, stopped by our table adding another special ambiance to the evening. Our courses ranged from the fried green tomato appetizer- to the Chefâ€™s special-rack of lamb â€“ ending in a delicious finish of sweet potato crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e. The entire evening was the perfect showcase to my out-of-town family of the very finest that Georgia has to offer.
Went for date night, enjoyed the ambiance sitting by the fireplace.

column4: 116 East Ponce de Leon Avenue Decatur, GA  30030
column13: My family visited Parker's to celebrate a recent accomplishment of mine. I thought the service was great. The manager or it may have been the owner came by our table to check on us--that was nice. I had the trout entree with I believe asparagus and mashed potatoes. The dish was good, my only complaint is there was a tad bit too much kosher/sea salt sprinkled on top of my dish, but not salty throughout the dish. Everyone else enjoyed their food (steak dish and shrimp and grits), but we all agreed our food was lukewarm versus hot, like we would have liked.

Food was great, service great! It was a "little" slow but would not keep me from returning. The atmosphere was not cozy enough to say it was romantic, don't drink so can't comment on the wine, bar... It was too cold to sit outside, but the outdoor seating looked very inviting. The food and service were VERY good and would entice me to return.

Nice restaurant. There's a club next door that, when we arrived around 8:45pm, was EXTREMELY loud. But after sitting down for dinner, the music was not that noticeable. Food was good as was the service, albeit a bit slow. The food was a bit pricy given the dishes on the menu, but not too overpriced. We would return in the future.
First dinner at Pasta da Pulcinella and a good one at that. My wife and I enjoyed our salads and entres. We enjoyed eating on the porch.

Reliably excellent restaurant with great food and service. We were with friends celebrating a 45th wedding anniversary, and they brought us a special dessert which was really nice. Have eaten at this restaurant many times, and we always bring out-of-town guests here for a great neighborhood/local Atlanta experience.

column4: 250 Park Avenue West, Suite 104 Atlanta, GA  30313
column13: I was pleasantly surprised. The food was great and the ambiance was spotless.

Prior to becoming Peter's this was High Cotton, which we frequented several times a year when in the area... decided to try Peter's and can't say we'll be back... splitting a salad and two entrees (salmon and spaghetti and meatballs) should not be $60 (we drank water, no wine)... especially when it wasn't really all that great... it was fine - just fine - nothing at all special... the service was good - just shy of over the top... but one waiter (not ours) was for sure over the top and VERY loud... I could tell you what the desserts were, and how hard he was trying to sell them from the minute we walked in...

column4: 2935 N. Druid Hills Road Atlanta, GA  43276
column13: A group of 3 of us went to Petite Auberge for dinner thinking it would just be standard French fare, but were pleasantly surprised that we had gotten there while they were doing a special October Fest menu. That gave us many more options. Bothe the traditional Chicken Cordon Bleu and the german dishes were very well prepared and delicious. The Bavarian sampler platter was HUGE and all very tasty. Our servers were knowledgeable and very friendly keeping everyone's beverages refilled and in all we had a great time. We'll definately be back. More people should try this restaurant - it's great.

column4: 24 East Main Street Suite B Dahlonega, GA  30533
column13: Real good food at the porter house.. Crab fritters are delicious and pretty rare in N. Georgia.Will definitely be back...

Second time here. The food is very good and the service is excellent. Our waitress, Laura was professional, personable and polite. The ambiance is warm but energetic. Can't wait to go back. Highly recommend !
Excellent food, nice atmosphere, decent service. Good wine list that does not trump up the charge. Well recommended.

Taco Tuesday is a hit. They have 20+ different tacos to choose from. Very tasty. This is my third time eating here and all three times I have had to call them back to get them to post my Open Table reservation.

column4: 3393 Peachtree Rd. 2nd Floor, Suite 4030 Atlanta, GA  30326
column13: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Atlanta. The food is always wonderful and the service is great. Our waiter was outstanding. I love the creme brÃ»lÃ©e. I can't wait to go back again.
Excellent service and menu selections. Wait staff is very attentive

I have been to Pura Vida about five to six times and have had excellent food, drinks and service every time. I am convinced that everything on the menu is fantastic and have never had a tapa there that I would not get again. The ambiance and music are a perfect fit for the style of food.
Dinner was good. Not the best steak ever, but good! Husband got the seafood platter and really enjoyed it! Good place to try, would probably go back.

My husband and I went to Ray's for our 1st anniversary celebration. When my husband arrived (before me) carrying roses, the hostess asked what the occasion was. He told her it was our anniversary, and she sprinkled our table with "Happy Anniversary" confetti that they had on hand. They apparently had a few different types of confetti depending on your occasion. We also had three servers taking care of us, and the manager stopped by to wish us happy anniversary as well. The service was outstanding. The recommendations made by the servers were all delicious, and we were given a lovely anniversary dessert complete with "Happy Anniversary" written on the plate in chocolate. We had a lovely evening dining at Ray's. Would definitely recommend!

column4: 6700 Powers Ferry Road Sandy Springs, GA  30339
column13: Best Seafood that I've had in Atlanta.
Food was pretty good. They dont always have seafood (even on the weekends) and shrimp is additional cost.

column4: 1255 Johnson Ferry Rd Suite 16 Marietta, GA  30068
column13: Great experience. Food was excellent. Should have ordered more! Our server wasn't the greatest. Not very attentive and not very friendly. She seemed annoyed we were taking our time to order. Enjoyed the music.
We were there on election night so it was exceedingly quiet which was a nice surprise. The food was excellent as always. The vegetable entree was a highlight.

column1: Rocks on the River at the Bohemian Hotel - Savannah
column13: We had brunch reservations for 8 people and we were seated promptly. It didnâ€™t seem that busy, but the employees seemed a bit frazzled. They seemed a bit understaffed for a Sunday Brunch and Iâ€™m sure they know that a marathon was held in town the day before. Our food was very good. Very large portions. If you want outdoor seating, I suggested requesting when you make your reservations. I would definitely go back, overall good experience.

I was please for the meal I ordered....the special tuna tetaki salad. I had requested to have sashimi instead of tetaki but the chef refused to be flexible. While the meal was good I was disappointed that they were unwilling to replace the meat that topped the salad. Overall the service was excellent.
Best guacamole we've found in Atlanta. Awesome mole sauce too.
Love that most of the food is local. Get the big nasty sandwich. Amazing...

This place is great all around. I first went here with my family and my friends family, and the food was so delicious I had to return. When my boyfriend came into town, I took him here for our anniversary dinner. He's a meat eater and I'm a vegetarian, and we both left stuffed. For appetizer, we got the rumis dip, which is a really smooth hummus. Last time, I got the Mirza gazim ( eggplant dip ). I prefer the eggplant dip, but it's all good. Of course they also give you a little plate of fixings And, a complementary basket of pita bread. For entree ( the prices are high but the portions are huge), he got the beef barg (their specialty) And I got a veggie kabob. Both come with tons of rice. Our server was awesome (Reza). Def coming back
Very nice as always. Superb steaks and service.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Centennial Park
column13: Terrible service. Went the night of the Falcons game and they didn't have enough waiters. The manager and Kimmie were excellent. However, the waiter was overwhelmed.
The food is fantastic and the service is great. The only downside is that there are no windows so it can be quite dark inside.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Sandy Springs
column13: I loved the chicken stuft entree. Freakin Delicious!!!!
Our server was excellent . Very professional and personable. The food was delicious.

We took our visiting daughter there on a Saturday night around 7 and the music was so loud that we had a hard time having a conversation without straining. We asked the server to turn it down but I think it was a musician but in any case it didn't happen. The food was not terrible but just fair. My fish was salty and the bow tie pasta was soaked in a buttery sauce. My husband ordered the ribeye steak and said it was not the best. This was my second try at the restaurant and we won't return. There are too many other places that are in the price range that are much better.
Nice place and the wait staff is highly knowledgeable about the food.
both staff and food were excellent, owner even came by to make sure all was great, will not hesitate to return
Much better than a typical hotel restaurant.

We thoroughly enjoyed our experience at Seed! The food was wonderful, as usual, and the first-time diners at our table with very impressed with everything from the food to the atmosphere. Our server, Bryan, was gracious, knowledgeable and friendly. We will be back for sure!

This was my third time dining here for brunch. The food was excellent. The service was lousy. Had one waiter who came and we never saw him again. Another waitress came...said it was her first day. She couldn't answer a question about the menu. Was not very attentive.
Wanted to a nice quiet dinner towards the latter part of Saturday night and the SHED was perfect. The salmon was incredible as was the ravioli/lamb sausage plate. There were no leftovers whatsoever.

I have a friends of Tom card. And I like twist and prime the best. I like the food at shout. But I may never I mean never return again. I remeber how at one point this was a nice place. Not any longer. I was added 18 percent gratis for a party of two. Then I notated on the special instructions in my reservations. It was my friends birthday. No one even said a word. Overall. I would not recommend. And I will celebrate at twist or prime in the future.......

column1: Shula's 347 Grill -  Atlanta Marriott Buckhead Hotel
column13: Cathy had a great birthday dinner!

column4: Post Riverside Town Square; 4403 Northside Parkway Atlanta, GA  30327
column13: Sip is a fun place to go with a group. Its wine by the glass concept is fun for sampling, with lots of variety and quality for the money. However, the highlight for us was the fabulous small plates artfully created by Chef Bob Greenshields. He enthusiastically presented each dish and even made a few off-the-menu favorites for us. The tuna tartar is a MUST!! Very creative, unique and tasty. We all had a wonderful time.

column4: 3621 Vinings Slope Drive, sutie 4110 Atlanta, GA  30339
column13: Great place to sit outside when the weather is nice. The service is great and we have never been rushed. The best part of all is that our dog is allowed with us on the patio (and treated very well!)

column4: 4300 Paces Ferry Road, Suite 107 Atlanta, GA  30339
column13: Crab and Angus Beef Sliders were great and a good value for $4.00 each. We also enjoyed the Clam Chowder special.
The food was delicious and our waiter was outstanding. We are going back as soon as we can and taking our friends and family with us.
Great wine list, outstanding food, a little more lighting in patio seating would go a long way... only down side...cocktails need vast improvement.

column4: 1675 Cumberland Parkway in One Ivy Walk Smyrna, GA  30080
column13: Fried Chicken and Shrimp & Grits were wonderful. The cheese ball appetizer with spicy honey was excellent, and the She Crab Soup was excellent. We had late reservations on a Monday night, so the noise level may be different on a weekend, but we enjoyed our dinner and enjoyed the atmosphere.

The food was delicious, however I am giving bad ratings on service because I was OVER CHARGED twice for my lunch. I called the manager and he stated it would take 24hrs to clear which has not been the case. I don't know what kind of racket they are running but if you eat there pay with CASH

Have always wanted dine here, but was very disappointed in the overall taste of the food. I also don't like seeing exposed tattooed arms cooking my food. I would expect to see that at the neighborhood pub. This restaurant seems to have good potential, but was very disappointing especially for the price per entree.

Service was terribly uneven: appetizers not delivered at the same time; same for the entrees, which were also slightly cool.Server was personable but not very attentive - forgetting things, not checking on drinks (he could have had a higher ticket - and tip - if he had made the effort to sell more cocktails). The resturant was not so full to cause service to be so poor.On a scale from 1 to 10: 6

Sprig is a great neighborhood gem with an often changing menu filled with tasty locally grown options. They have a terrific beer selection and a rotating bourbon flight if you're in that kind of mood. While the menu changes often, there are some meals that stick around that are worth every bite. The Brasstown, GA grass fed meatloaf is an amazing comfort food option and comes with a side of macaroni and cheese (also good) and green beans. The "half" option is plenty for a grown person who doesn't want to grow TOO much. The Lamb Stroganoff is another tasty staple - again half is plenty for a normal human being. All of the fish dishes we have tried have been done well. We can't recommend this place enough!

column4: 2255 Peachtree Road Suite E&F Atlanta, GA  30309
column13: Some of the very best sushi in Atlanta. So glad I found you, Starfish. You are now a monthly appointment with me!
Less than impressed with the food. Portions were too large. I was disappointed that my tilapia was soaked in oil. Steel feels like a chain restaurant.

column4: 102 West Paces Ferry Road, Suite E Atlanta, GA  30305
column13: As a local Buckheadite, I am so happy to have STG in the neighborhood. We were truly lacking a place like this. Everything about it makes you want to come back. We have been four times, and each time we had an excellent meal. On our most recent weeknight visit, we ordered three pasta dishes, one with duck (mine, with moist, tender duck and artichokes was amazing), one with lamb and one with bolognese. Each of us thought our dish was the best. That is an excellent test of a restaurant. We eyed the Pizzas coming out of the oven at the next table, and they were perfectly charred and dispensed with quickly (and they are very large pies). Wine selection is excellent and for-purchase in the front of the restaurant.
Absolutely delicious! The salads, appetizers, entrees and sides were all phenomenal! Highly recommend!

column4: 10305 Medlock Br. Road, at the Shoppes of St. Ives Duluth, GA  30097
column13: We went with a party of eight. Everyone was very happy with their choices. We ordered everything from the halibut special to flatbread. We were very pleased that they gave us. A private room which is a plus for a table of eight.
Food and service was exceptional as always!we can always count on great food & outstanding service!

column1: Sun in my Belly - Neighborhood Cafe
column13: What a great find! As good as the food was (and it was great), the service was even better. The staff could not have been friendlier and helpful. I went to dinner on a Tuesday night...there was a nice crowd but the restaurant was not full. From appetizers, salads, entree and dessert, the meal was spot on. We can't wait to go back!
We have eaten here on many occasions and the sushi's always fresh & yummy. We hadn't been back since they updated the menu, but it's still as good as before and one of our favorite places to eat.

Wonderful Sunday dinner with music and excellent Southern-inspired gourmet cuisine. Service was excellent, attentive to needs of an 85 year old celebrating her birthday. This spot delivers consistently!
Some modern, fresh takes on southern style selections. Light and flavorful. Very personable owner and staff. We will enjoy bringing out of town guests here as well as ourselves!

Table 1280 depends too much on the Woodruff Art Center and High Museum to provide customers. We ate lunch there after visiting an exhibit at the High and we were almost alone in the place. The food, however, was quite good and presented and served well. Perhaps for the evening/symphony crowd the business picks up -- if not I wouldn't expect to see Table 1280 open much longer. Atlanta has a plethora of good restaurants that are not so far off the "beaten path."
very disappointing, sushi was very mediocre.

We came here for dinner because of having a coupon, but we were pleasantly surprised at how delicious the sashimi was, along with the ginger. We also had a steamed pot sticker type appetizer and rock scallops appetizer that were very tasty. We'll definitely return.
Great for birthday dinners for groups who don't want to spend much money!

Went on a date night with my wife, and the host accommodated us with a quiet corner. Food was very good, prices reasonable and portions smaller than most Thai restaurants. We enjoyed our martini and meals, and will return next time we are out in Midtown.

A neighbor recommended Tantra. We were not disappointed. The decor is lovely and exudes a peacefulness. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. Highly recommend the Hummas Naan, Cucumber and Tomato Salad, Lamb Frites and Scallops. The food that we dined on was fresh and flavorful and the presentation attractive. The service was friendly, very helpful and attentive. We look forward to our next visit!

column4: 3324 Cobb Pkwy SE (Riverview Village Shopping Center) Atlanta, GA  30339
column13: Wonderful neighborhood Italian gem. The food was very fresh, creative and flavorful. And the portions were just right. It was a very enjoyable dining experience for our family. I'm looking forward to our next visit.

column4: 2196 Cheshire Bridge Road NE Atlanta, GA  30324
column13: Being just back from Greece, we longed for some of the food we enjoyed there, Taverna Plaka's offerings were exactly what we were looking for. The plates had great flavor and were very close to those we had in some of the restaurants in Crete, Santorini and Athens. Our server was extremely helpful in either explaining how the dishes would be served there and made sure we wanted for nothing. Friday night is a night where you can eat and enjoy the talents of a belly dancer who was not only skilled in her practice but very comfortable in getting guests involved in her show. All in all I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that wants a little taste of Greece and a good meal.

We were looking for a last minute spot to go out to eat with family from out of town ( a group of 8!) and had a great time at Teela Taqueria. It was the perfect place for a group with many different preferences. The options were great, the drinks were fantastic and the amount of food was just right!

Arrived for a late night dinner so place nearly deserted- ordered the crab cakes - they had a smell of old oil and tasted like the oil had been used to fry fish- it was awful- the server offered to bring something else so I ordered a veggie dish- even that was less than appealing- have eaten here about a half a dozen times because it is convenient to several theaters in area but it is hit or miss- have had both good and bad experiences- this one being a bad one- need to find another " go to..." as I am tired of playing the odds

The service was wonderful & everything we ordered tasted great: Fried green tomatoes (a side we had as an app), scallops & grits, trout, & creme brulee. The only quibble we had with any food was that my companion said that the trout was a bit too salty, BUT he ate the skin maybe that's why. Cons: Beer & wine lists are short & weak, nothing notable. Cocktail list mostly read like sweet unappealing (to us) fluff BUT we ordered the cucumber martini & it was awesome! SO, everything we had was GREAT! If you park in the garage behind/under Thrive, make sure that as soon as you enter you turn right into the caged area--that is the only free parking in the garage. We missed it, had to pay $10. Can also park on the street, plenty of spaces at 6pm.

The culinary experience here at Tomo was very creative with outstanding sushi/sashimi- Especially notable was the Kampachi and the Scallop roll. Boston Cod wrap was exquisitely delicious as a cooked Japanese item.

column4: Hilton Atlanta 255 Courtland Street, NE Atlanta, GA  30303
column13: YOU'VE GOT TO TRY THE BANANAS FOSTER DESSERT! IT IS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!

St. Simons has a wonderful selection of great places to eat, but Tramici is our favorite island restaurant--for multiple reasons. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and are able offer informed recommendations if needed. The atmosphere is casual with just enough romantic ambiance that it's great for special occasions too. The quality of food served is above what you'd expect with such reasonable pricing and rarely have we had a meal when the manager, owner or chef didn't stop by and say hello to their guests. Leaving no stone unturned, Tramici's hostess is everything you want in a hostess/greeter that you simply don't find at most other establishments. Consistently an all around great place to have lunch or dinner.

column4: 60 Andrew Young International Boulevard Atlanta, GA  30303
column13: Maybe we went on the wrong Saturday night, because there was no on there. The belly dancer was the highlight of the noise.

We Had a great per-concert meal. Small plates make great appetizers for sharing and main entrees are outstanding. Service was excellent and ambiance is great. Would come back again and I have already recommended to others.

This was my 2nd visit to TWO-and I was just as amazed this time as I was the first! My favorite part about isn't even inside the restaurant; I love how the entrance to the building is completely inconspicuous, and you are certain you are in the wrong place. But immediately upon opening the door, your sense are filled with music, delicious smells, gorgeous decoration, and amazing lightening. That moment is amazing. I love the reservation requirement; through this, you are automatically sat at a table upon arrival and there is no wait time. We arrived 30 minutes early and still had no wait! The Food - OH, THE FOOD. The brisket was to die for. Oh, the mac and cheese! The steak - best I've ever had. Don't even get me started on the drinks!

Valenza is too loud! But...it's a fun place with good food! We went around 7 pm and it was so noisy that one could not hold a conversation. We went at 9 pm this time and it wasn't nearly as noisy but the music was vibrating our table it was so loud. I don't feel this is necessary or adds to the ambiance. I'd still go back as it's a fun place!
one of the best pizzas in Atlanta.
Third time at VVV and brought some out of town friends along. They loved it's ambiance, but could you get everyone to quit say 'absolutely' to every request or statement! Thanks

column4: 9810 Medlock Bridge Road Suite 900 Duluth, GA  30097
column13: Food and Service were excellent!! My wife said the steak she had was in the top 2. If price is not an issue, this is the place to go.

It is a plus (I am disabled) that you can enter this Savannah River spot from Bay Street, rather than having to negotiate your way down to the riverside. We were gently treated although 15 minutes early for our reservation. Waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu, preparation, and was very efficient. I had their Angus burger and my wife had the arugula and greens salad with grilled shrimp. Both dishes prepared expertly (to include a medium rare burger, shows confidence in their meat) and delicious. Lovely old Savannah building with windows looking out over the river. Great location, view, food and service.

I specifically went for the crab benedict, but decided on something else. My husband and I actually "grazed",- 2 apps. shared shrimp and grits (which was split in the kitchen) and the wonderful carrot cake!

It has gotten to the point that this is my favorite restaurant. Love Muss and Turner and Pasta da Pulcinella, but this place has delicious, perfectly prepared pastas and pizzas, but -- IT IS AFFORDABLE! Saturday we had the fig and prosciutto pizza, and egg white pasta with sausage and brocolli rabe. Excellent - as always. Did I mention the inexpensive vodka (Ketel 1) martinis?

This is my 5th visit to Vinny's on Windward and every time it is excellent. The food choices, the wine choices, the ambience, the service - it is always fantastic. The shrimp and scallop risotto is delicious, as are the crab cakes. I highly recommend Vinny's for lunch or dinner.
We always enjoy Violette. The food is very good and consistent and the service and atmosphere is excellent.

column4: 1000 Marietta St. NW, Suite 202 Atlanta, GA  30318
column13: This restaurant is new, so granted there are things that need to be worked on with the service. The proportions were good, and the food was great. There was a nice fire place where you could sit and have a cocktail. The dining room was full when we got there which is good considering from reading past reviews, people said it was somewhat empty. I was a little confused because we were greeted by one server who took our app order and shortly after we were greeted by another server who also offered tot take our order. Our server forgot to put in our appetizer order and we ended up getting it after our entrees. However they comped it as well as our drinks. I would consider returning once they get the service kinks out.

This restaurant is very convenient to many downtown Atlanta hotels. Thus, a great spot for a casual business dinner. Several colleagues and myself dined around seven thirtyon a week night. The service started soon enough. We ordered drinks and appetizers. No first course, just entrees--steaks. We knew we were in trouble when we were brought a second round of a favorite starter. Almost fifty minutes later, dinner arrived. A manager did stop by at one point to tell us that the food was a little slow.We were also given a complimentary dessert. I would certainly go back realizing that service could be an issue.
Well kept secret that needs a full bar. Food plentiful and very tasty, coconut soup too sweet for my taste but my date loved it. Service was swift and professional.
Wonderful food! Wonderful staff! Lovely restaurant!
The food and service were the best we have ever had anywhere, anytime! It was a most pleasurable experience.

Food is good, and thought service was good until I later checked the bill and found out he charged us $10 for Legendario which no one ordered nor received. Unfortunately we didn't scrutinize the bill before paying. Don't make our mistake!!
I love Zen on Ten its one of my favorite spots.
